intro: Blepharis tetrasticha, commonly known as the four-stalked blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators. Blepharis tetrasticha is a perennial herb that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
